channel.title: Wireless internet issues
channel.description:
hey everyone, i just have a bit of a wireless internet issue.
my modem/router is a belkin 54g.
well i have 2 computers connected to it through ethernet cables and 3 laptops and 1 desktop for wireless.
the 2 desktops that are connected run the internet fine as does one of the laptops. (the newest one)(toshiba)
this all happened when i plugged in my x box 360 to the router. after unplugging this bug started (not sure if it did anything)
the 3 unwired computers get stuck on aquiring ip address while trying to connect and then get a limited or no connection message. (no internet) (both these laptops are acer)
i have tried winsock and the windows updates. restarting the router from 192.168.2.1 assigning static ips to 1 of the non working laptops
any help would be great.
thanks

item.title: Wireless internet issues
item.dc:creator: @o_town_reaper o_town_reaper
item.description:
@o_town_reaper wrote:

Well the only advice i got is unplug the router and wait a little bit and then plug it back in and see if works, or check to see if by accident you switched wires around. I have had that problem before.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet issues
item.dc:creator: @MOD_B-RAD MOD B-RAD
item.description:
@MOD_B-RAD wrote:

yes i had that same problem with my computer you can also call your local phone company for assistance

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet issues
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

tmt100, you realize that by posting more information than necessary, you actually make people want to help you out. Let all noobs take note of of this.

From you said, we can definitely isolate it to the wireless portion of your router. You said one of your wireless laptops can connect wirelessly while the other ones canâ€™t?

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless internet issues
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Unplug the router, wait 60 seconds, and plug it back in.

Read full topic
